newsitem.title: FRANCE: PSA units set 4 billion Ffr MTN issues.
newsitem.headline: PSA units set 4 billion Ffr MTN issues.

text.p: French car maker PSA Peugeot Citroen said its Banque PSA Finance Holding and Peugeot Finance International NV units launched two domestic medium-term note programmes for two billion francs each on July 31.
"The two MTN programmes will furnish PSA Finance Holding with medium-term resources at the best conditions on the French domestic financial markets," it said in a statement.

It said the two issues -- rated A- by Standard & Poor's -- complement the medium-term financing resources of PSA Finance Holding, which groups the car maker's credit subsidiaries, along with a Euro Medium Term Note issue set in April 1994.
